DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine efficacy safety diabetes-specific tube feed comparison isocaloric , isonitrogenous standard enteral formula critically ill patient receive insulin treatment blood glucose management .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Safety Study Low-carbohydrate Tube Feed Critically Ill Patients Under Insulin Therapy
DOC.criteria: Patients spontaneous aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage ( SAH ) define accord Hunt Hess scale grade HH5 Requiring mechanical ventilation ICU time enrolment Enteral nutrition ( EN ) ICU time enrolment If enrolment day 3 ICU stay , EN equal large 80 % total calorie case supplementary parenteral nutrition ( PN ) anticipate 100 % EN day 4 8 ICU stay If enrolment day 4 ICU stay , 100 % EN plan least 5 day time enrolment Patients expect stay ICU least 5 day follow enrolment Age 18 75 year Glycemic control intravenous insulin therapy maintain target glucose range 110 mg/dL 150 mg/dL ( 6.1 8.3 mmol/l ) Informed consent accord local regulation decisionally impaired subject Patients septic shock time enrolment Participation clinical trial investigational product within 4 week study Patients require fibre free diet Total supplementary parenteral nutrition ( > 20 % total calorie ) Known suspect intolerance allergy component study product ( ) , e.g . galactosemia Gastrectomy Postpyloric nutrition Any clinical condition allow enteral nutrition ( e.g . emesis , severe reflux , severe diarrhea ) Known severe heart failure ( NYHA class 4 ) Liver insufficiency / failure ( male : ALAT > 150 U/l ; female : ALAT > 120 U/l ) Acute kidney failure ( blood creatinine > 2.5 mg/dl ) Body Mass Index < 18 > 35 kg/mÂ² Known suspicion drug abuse Pregnant breast feed woman Patients diabetes mellitus type I Exclusion After Enrolment ( Withdrawal Subjects ) Start PN 20 % total give energy amount/ day Insulin infusion stop unexpectedly > 12h nonnutritional reason Discharge ICU Intolerable AEs Major protocol violation Withdrawal inform consent Discontinuation study treatment reason
